frame.name: Contrary_circumstances
frame.definition: <def-root>An <fen>Event</fen> takes place despite the existence of an <fen>Adversity</fen> that would otherwise support <fen>Contrary_circumstances</fen> or results. <ex></ex> <ex><fex name="Event">He finished the race</fex> <t>despite</t> <fex name="Adversity">his ankle breaking</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Event
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Event</fen> that occurs despite an <fen>Adversity</fen> that would seem to contradict the possibility of its occurence. </def-root>

FE.name: Adversity
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Adversity</fen> is a state of affairs or entity that hinders or negatively affects the <fen>Event</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Contrary_circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Contrary_circumstances</fen> are the circumstances that would normally be expected to occur given the presence of the <fen>Adversity</fen>. </def-root>
